item.title: Lauren add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If a problem is fixable, if a situation is such that you can do something about it, then there is no need to worry. If it's not fixable, then there is no help in worrying. There is no benefit in worrying whatsoever." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. Theyâ€™re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Robert Byrne
item.description: "Learning to dislike children at an early age saves a lot of expense and aggravation later in life." -- Robert Byrne

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "No work is insignificant. All labor that uplifts humanity has dignity and importance and should be undertaken with painstaking excellence." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Matsuo Basho
Lauren add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "Poets and philosophers are the unacknowledged legislators of the world." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "How narrow we selfish conceited creatures are in our sympathies! How blind to the rights of all the rest of creation!" -- John Muir

item.title: Lauren add a quote by A.J. Cronin
item.description: "Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, but only saps today of its strength." -- A.J. Cronin

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Adelle Davis
item.description: "We are indeed much more than what we eat, but what we eat can nevertheless help us to become much more than what we are." -- Adelle Davis

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "Soar, eat ether, see what has never been seen; depart, be lost, but climb." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Mason Cooley
item.description: "Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are." -- Mason Cooley

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "At times you have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself." -- Alan Alda

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Michael Forte
item.description: "Don't go through life so fast that someone has to throw a brick at you to get you to pay attention." -- Michael Forte

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "The more I learn about the universe, the less convinced I am that there's any sort of benevolent force that has anything to do with it, at all." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Janeane Garofalo
item.description: "Leaving your ears open to the suggestions of others only closes the mind's eye, thereby creating a type of spiritual glaucoma." -- Janeane Garofalo

item.title: Lauren add a quote by William O. Douglas
item.description: "Only when there is a wilderness can man harmonize his inner being with the wavelengths of the earth. When the earth, its products, its creatures, become his concern, man is caught up in a cause greater than his own life and more meaningful. Only when man loses himself in an endeavor of that magnitude does he walk and live with humanity and reverence." -- William O. Douglas

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Jalalu'l-din Rumi
item.description: "I know you're tired but come, this is the way." -- Jalalu'l-din Rumi

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Let us try to recognize the precious nature of each day." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Te-Shan
item.description: "Just have no mind on things and no things on mind, and you will naturally be empty and spiritual, tranquil and sublime." -- Te-Shan

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "There is no God. But it does not matter. Man is enough." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "When life gives you lemons, chunk it right back." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Homer
item.description: "There is a time for many words, and there is also a time for sleep." -- Homer

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction." -- Rachel Carson

item.title: Lauren add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There is no love sincerer than the love of food." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Chris Evans
item.description: "Change is bad. Must rally against change." -- Chris Evans

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books." -- Walt Whitman
